metadata.title: CVE-2012-2330 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Update method in src/node_http_parser.cc in Node.js before 0.6.17 and0.7 before 0.7.8 does not properly check the length of a string, whichallows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information (request headercontents) and possibly spoof HTTP headers via a zero length string.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

nodejs - 0.6.17~dfsg1-1ubuntu1
nodejs-legacy - 0.6.17~dfsg1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.17~dfsg1-1ubuntu1').
